system.description:
Starting at 5th level, you have learned how to weaponize your toys more effectively. When you would create the following items using your Tactical Chemistry ability, you may choose to create it in the form of a wind-up toy instead:

@UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-adventuring-gear.Item.4t0m2ttaca5hg2vi]{Alchemist's Fire (flask)}

@UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-adventuring-gear.Item.yrsiymhg2jgu9vdd]{Black Powder Charge}

@UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-adventuring-gear.Item.67lx2tqow4t9aiwp]{Flash bomb}

@UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-adventuring-gear.Item.erxssofi2jlptyv7]{Smoke bomb}

@UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-adventuring-gear.Item.ukcav3i8dudpalir]{Tanglefoot Bag}

Toys created in this fashion last a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1) before dissolving into useless sludge. When you place the toy on the ground, it begins to walk in whatever direction it is facing. The toy has an AC of 10, 1 hit point, and a speed of 10 feet per round. It can only walk in a straight line and cannot change trajectory. Your tactical toys otherwise appear as normal child’s toys, and any creatures attempting to discern them as anything but must make a Perception check versus your passive Deception score to see them for the dangerous bits of arcano-science that they are. As a bonus action, you may command the toy to explode, producing the effects of the item created. You must be within 120 feet of the toy but do not need to see it to issue this command.
